intro: Daucus crithmifolius, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in coastal areas and sandy soils, often growing in rocky or saline environments. Daucus crithmifolius is also known for its aromatic foliage and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
